direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods interact with the queue's head element, but 'poll' removes the element while 'peek' does not.
Both methods retrieve the head element of the queue, but 'element' throws an exception if the queue is empty, unlike 'peek'.
Both methods interact with the queue, but 'offer' adds an element to the queue while 'peek' retrieves the head element.
Both methods interact with the queue's head element, but 'remove' removes and returns the head element, while 'peek' only retrieves it.
Both methods synchronize on the lock and handle potential exceptions, but 'equals' compares objects while 'peek' retrieves the head element.
Both methods synchronize on the lock and handle potential exceptions, but 'hashCode' computes the hash code while 'peek' retrieves the head element.
